title: Zach Bryan Announces MetLife Stadium Show with Kings of Leon
description: Bryan called the massive gig “one of the only shows” he will play next year. Zach Bryan Announces MetLife Stadium Show with Kings of Leon Jo Vito
author: Jo Vito
excerpt: Zach Bryan has announced a massive concert at MetLife Stadium with Kings of Leon taking place on July 20th, 2025. Learn how to get tickets
text: Zach Bryan has announced a concert with Kings of Leon at the MetLife Stadium on July 20th, 2025, calling it “one of the only shows” he will play next year. Sharing the details of the concert on Instagram, Bryan wrote, “Always been a dream to play MetLife Stadium, so we’re doin it with Kings of Leon… New York City we’re coming for ya.” Get Zach Bryan Tickets Here Tickets for the show will go on sale via Ticketmaster on Friday, November 15th at 1:00 p.m. ET. Once tickets are on sale, fans can can look for deals via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. In other news, Bryan recently released two new songs, “This World’s a Giant” and “High Road,” which seemingly allude to his recent, highly-publicized break-up with Brianna LaPaglia. “New York this time of year ain’t good for me/ ’Cause all my friends lack self-control and empathy … Everyone is tellin’ me that I need help or therapy/ But all I need is to be left alone,” he sings on the verses for “High Road,” before reaching the chorus line, “I’vе waited by the telеphone all fuckin’ night/ For someone that ain’t ever gonna call.” In an Instagram post, Bryan wrote that he first wrote the chorus for “High Road” a few months ago, but was inspired to finish and release the new music after visiting his mother’s grave in Oklahoma. Stream the songs below. Bryan released his most recent album, The Great American Bar Scene, over the summer.
html:
Zach Bryan has announced a concert with Kings of Leon at the MetLife Stadium on July 20th, 2025, calling it “one of the only shows” he will play next year.

Sharing the details of the concert on Instagram, Bryan wrote, “Always been a dream to play MetLife Stadium, so we’re doin it with Kings of Leon… New York City we’re coming for ya.”

Get Zach Bryan Tickets Here

Tickets for the show will go on sale via Ticketmaster on Friday, November 15th at 1:00 p.m. ET. Once tickets are on sale, fans can can look for deals via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program.

In other news, Bryan recently released two new songs, “This World’s a Giant” and “High Road,” which seemingly allude to his recent, highly-publicized break-up with Brianna LaPaglia. “New York this time of year ain’t good for me/ ’Cause all my friends lack self-control and empathy … Everyone is tellin’ me that I need help or therapy/ But all I need is to be left alone,” he sings on the verses for “High Road,” before reaching the chorus line, “I’vе waited by the telеphone all fuckin’ night/ For someone that ain’t ever gonna call.”

In an Instagram post, Bryan wrote that he first wrote the chorus for “High Road” a few months ago, but was inspired to finish and release the new music after visiting his mother’s grave in Oklahoma. Stream the songs below.

Bryan released his most recent album, The Great American Bar Scene, over the summer.
